solution_line_template: First, we need to determine how many siblings Billy has. To do this, we perform {sisters}*{multiplier_brothers}= <<{sisters}*{multiplier_brothers}={num_brothers}>>{num_brothers} brothers, as he has {sisters} sisters and twice as many brothers as sisters.

Then we divide the total number of sodas in the 12 pack, which is {total_sodas}, by the number of siblings, performing {total_sodas}/{total_siblings}=<<{total_sodas}/{total_siblings}={sodas_per_sibling}>>{sodas_per_sibling} cans per person.
